intro: Trachydium garhwalicum, commonly known as the Garhwal starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves and a slender, unbranched stem that bears small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is typically found in alpine and subalpine regions of the Himalayas, particularly in India and Nepal. It thrives in moist, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Trachydium garhwalicum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
